newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuania Utenos to sign Pepsi deal - report.
newsitem.headline: Lithuania Utenos to sign Pepsi deal - report.

text.p: Lithuanian brewer Utenos Beverages is set to sign a five-year deal to bottle PepsiCo Inc products in Lithuania, daily Lietuvos rytas said on Tuesday.
The newspaper quoted Utenos board chairman Arunas Lubys as saying that the company's board had approved the final draft of the contract and that it could be signed this week.
The paper said that Pepsi-Cola General Bottlers would invest $600,000 in the Utenos plant and install a water cleaning and softening station.
Pepsi-Cola General Bottlers will handle the sales of its products in Lithuania itself, the newspaper said.
It added that the Pepsi products bottled at Utenos would be distributed in all three Baltic states.
Utenos currently has the biggest share of the lucrative Lithuanian beer market.
